intro: Chazaliella macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited chazalina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its climbing habit and tendrils. The plant produces large, showy flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its fruits are fleshy and contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Chazaliella macrocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
